your sweater you will now continue to work in stockinette stitch until your sleeve measures approximately 40 cm 16 in whilst also working some decreases to give the sleeve some shape you will work the following decrease round every 13 13 13 10 8 6 5 5 5 5 5 3 5 2 5 2 5 2 cm 5 25 5 25 5 25 4 3 25 2 5 2 25 2 25 1 5 1 1 0 75 in a total of 3 3 3 4 5 6 7 7 10 14 16 20 times decrease round slip bor marker knit 1 k2tog knit to 3 stitches before the end of the round ssk knit 1 -2 stitches continue working in stockinette stitch until your sleeve measures approximately 40 cm 16 in or 5 cm 2 in shorter than your ideal length note if you wish to adjust the length of the sleeve to better suit your needs or preferences you should divide your preferred length minus 5 cm 2 in for the cuff by the number of decrease rounds you will work in order to find the decrease interval by the end of the sleeve you will have decreased a total of 6 6 6 8 10 12 14 14 20 28 32 40 stitches and you now have a total of 52 54 56 58 58 60 60 62 62 62 65 65 stitches note sizes k and l only will need to decrease 1 more stitch at the beginning of the cuff i recommend starting the first round of the cuff with a k2tog when you are happy with the length of your sleeve change to a 3 5 mm circular needle with your preferred cord length and work 5 cm 2 in in 1x1 rib i e *knit 1 purl 1* i worked 12 rounds for reference 14 if you would prefer to use a tubular cast-off which i strongly recommend you will need to work the following 2 rounds to set up the cast-off round 1 *knit 1 slip 1 purlwise wyif* to the
